availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Joseph Mitchell (Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary Ellen Mitchell. Father of Mary C. Mitchell, Lawrence Mitchell, John M. Mitchell, H. J. Mitchell, and Annie Mitchell. Attorney and real estate partner at Blakely & Mitchell, with James Blakely, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, in 1844. Attorney in Lawrenceville, Pennsylvania, in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Pennsylvania in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, Laurenceville, p. 65.; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, Pittsburgh, Ward 17, p. 96; Pittsburgh Daily Post (Pittsburgh, Pa.,), September 17, 1844, p. 3; Find A Grave, "John Joseph Mitchell (1819-1902)," Memorial #137688594, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=137688594&ref=acom (accessed May 9, 2017); KYR-0001-007-0388.
